fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28111].
  {panel}

We need to make a decision around each of the following entities and whether or not we will support them for configurable links. Right now, attempting to link to these using the link browser either (a) does nothing, or (b) shows a link with no link text:
* Spaces
* People
* Attachments
* Images

*If we aren't going to support these as links:*
We should stop them from being displayed in the link browser. Even though we've hidden irrelevant link browser panels, it's still possible to see these in the search results.

*If we are going to support these as links:*
We need to change our data model.
fields.summary: Link browser shows un-linkable entities when configuring sidebar links
Implement New Features for Task List

{code}

{code}

h5. Workaround
Edit the title of the page or remove the page include macro. You could edit the inaccessible page (that keeps throwing System Error) by hitting this direct URL:
- If the page URL looks like this:
{code}
http://<baseurl>/display/ds/test+include+macro
{code} 
You can edit it using this way:
{code}
http://<baseurl>/pages/editpage.action?spaceKey=ds&title=test+include+macro
{code} 
- If the page URL looks like this:
{code}
http://<baseurl>/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=884766
{code} 
You can edit it using this way:
{code}
http://<baseurl>/pages/editpage.action?pageId=884766
{code}
fields.summary: Include page macro of a page that contains some symbols in the page title would cause System Error and inaccessible page

fields.description:
Some warnings are appearing in Confluence log:

{code}
2013-02-12 20:43:31,590 WARN [http-8686-68] [atlassian.plugin.webresource.DefaultResourceDependencyResolver] resolveDependencies Cannot find web resource module for: com.atlassian.analytics.analytics-client:js-events
 -- url: /plugins/servlet/notifications-miniview | userName: xxxx | referer: http://confluence/display/RFPF/Errors+and+Warnings
{code}

Basically this bug is related to this [CONF-25603|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-25603], but we see now this same warning in Confluence 4.3.6 and 4.3.7.

*Workaround*

This message does not typically indicate an actual problem with the system. You can hide it by going to "Logging & Profiling" under the Administration settings, and adding a configuration for:

* {{com.atlassian.plugin.webresource}} – level ERROR.

This will hide all "WARN" level messages from this area of the system.
fields.summary: Too many warnings in log: "Cannot find web resource module for: …"

I'm working on getting descendant notifications' integration tests running with confluence 5 and have discovered that the HTML it's generating for update emails does not appear to be valid HTML .. other emails seem to be ok. {code} ------=_Part_72_1148224277.1360840565891Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printableContent-Disposition: inline
<=/td>
admin edi=ted the page:

= Chil=d Page

some Update=d content

View Online · Like · View Changes · Stop watching page =· Manage Notifications
This message was sent by Atlassian Confluence 5.0-beta5, Team Collaboration Software
------=_Part_72_1148224277.1360840565891Content-Type: image/png; name=avatar_909dc5ca9d66d2392b9d7bb6d625385fContent-Transfer-Encoding: base64Content-ID: Content-Disposition: attachment; filename=avatar_909dc5ca9d66d2392b9d7bb6d625385f ------=_Part_72_1148224277.1360840565891Content-Type: image/png; name=page-iconContent-Transfer-Encoding: base64Content-ID: Content-Disposition: attachment; filename=page-icon ------=_Part_72_1148224277.1360840565891-- {code} It's not just the 3D prefixing every quote, but the equals signs in the middle of attribute names!!! The following is a pretty classy example: {code} {code}

fields.description:
The allowable protocols for external links was expanded in this task: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-24665

The regex used is still too restrictive for some customers. And should be expanded to match the allowable characters as per the [RFC|http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986#section-3.1] whilst continuing to restrict dangerous protocols.

*Workaround*
 # Find <confluence_install>/confluence/WEB-INF/lib/confluence-4.x.x.jar and extract the contents of this file somewhere
 # Locate and edit com/atlassian/confluence/content/render/xhtml/antisamy-confluence-storage.xml
 # Around line 54 or so there should be a regex matching file, smb, irc, etc, similar to the following line:
{code:xml}
<regexp name="offsiteURL"
            value="(\s)*(((ht|f)tp(s?)|file|smb|irc|news|nntp|feed|cvs|git|svn|mvn|ssh|itms|notes)://|mailto:)[\p{L}\p{N}/]+[\p{L}\p{N}\p{Zs}\.\#@\$%\+&;:\-_~,\?=/!\(\)]*(\s)*" />
{code}
 # Add the desired protocol to this list (e.g. 'hansoft' or 'exp2') to this list and save. Should look like this
{code:xml}
<regexp name="offsiteURL"
            value="(\s)*(((ht|f)tp(s?)|file|smb|irc|news|nntp|feed|cvs|git|svn|mvn|ssh|itms|notes)://|mailto:|exp2:)[\p{L}\p{N}/]+[\p{L}\p{N}\p{Zs}\.\#@\$%\+&;:\-_~,\?=/!\(\)]*(\s)*" />
{code}
 # Place the modified XML file in the following directory: <confluence-install>/confluence/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/confluence/content/render/xhtml/ (create the directories if they do not exist)
 # Restart Confluence

Please note that allowing Confluence to save/render more link types can be a potential security risk. Additionally, this workaround is not a supported operation and may not be applicable to future upgrades as the product changes.

*Workaround with Collaborative Editing On*
 # In addition to the steps above, as of 6.2.2, it's possible to do the following
 # Find <confluence_install>/confluence/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/confluence-collaborative-editor-plugin-x.y.z.jar
 # Create a backup of the jar somewhere in a different directory.
 # Extract the contents and locate the two files js/util/is-valid-uri.js and js/util/is-valid-uri-min.js.
 # In both files, locate the list of allowed protocols (you can search for mailto: for example), and add the required protocols to that list separated by |. Proper JS Regex escaping is required here, so if the protocol is my-protocol1:// for example, it should be entered as
{code:java}
my-protocol1:\\/\\/{code}
 # Repackage the jar
 # Backup and the [Plugin Cache directories|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-clear-confluence-plugins-cache-297664846.html]
 # Clear out the [Plugin Cache directories|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-clear-confluence-plugins-cache-297664846.html]
 # Backup <confluence-install>/temp folder
 # Clear out the contents of the <confluence-install>/temp folder (make sure the folder still exists)
 # Start Confluence

Please note that allowing Confluence to save/render more link types can be a potential security risk. Additionally, this workaround is not a supported operation and may not be applicable to future upgrades as the product changes.
fields.summary: Expand external links security filtering to allow digits, plus, hyphen and periods in protocol
upgrade confluence 3.5 to 4.2.7 changed the size of the picture in the context

Create Link with a Target of New Window or Tab
Confluence  simultaneously editing - like Google Docs
Add ability to roll back plugins to previous versions
Have the ability to upload images from mobile devices.

fields.description:
h3. Problem
* Links to an anchor in a Confluence page of another space are broken when they are edited.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Select the text that you want to link
# Click _Insert >> Link_, and go to _Advanced_ tab
# In the Advanced tab, configure the link to point to an anchor in another page using this format:
{noformat}
SPACEKEY:PageName#AnchorName
{noformat}
# Save the link and the page.
# Click the link.
# Return to the page you edited and re-edit the link.
# Save the link *without making any changes* and save the page.
# Click the link.
# Return to the page you edited and attempt to re-edit the link.

h3. Expected Results
* Both times it is clicked, the link should take you to the correct destination page and scroll to the anchor.

h3. Actual Results
* The link only works the first time.
* When you return and edit the link, the "SPACKEY:" prefix is removed without notice. The link becomes:
{noformat}
PageName#AnchorName
{noformat}
* When this problem occurs, clicking the link takes you to a Create view to create a page with that name in the current space.

h3. Notes

On the first edit the link configuration appears to be correct in the source markup:
{code}
<ac:link ac:anchor="ANCHORNAME">
    <ri:page ri:content-title="PAGETITLE" ri:space-key="SPACKEY"/>
    <ac:plain-text-link-body><![CDATA[LINKTEXT]]></ac:plain-text-link-body>
</ac:link>
{code}

When editing the second time the source markup is unchanged, but in the Edit dialog the space prefix is removed:
!spacekey-removed-from-link.png|thumbnail! 

After the second edit the {{ri:space-key}} parameter is dropped.
{code}
<ac:link>
    <ri:page ri:content-title="Disabling and enabling apps"/>
    <ac:plain-text-link-body><![CDATA[enable safe mode]]></ac:plain-text-link-body>
{code}

The original reporter also noted, "It used to be uneditable prior to 4.3.6, as it was fixed in that version."

h3. Workaround

Use the "Web Link" option instead and paste in the absolute/static URL, e.g. http(s)://HOST/SPACEKEY/PAGE#ANCHOR

NOTE: This link breaks if the name or space of the target page is changed.
fields.summary: Links to anchors in another Confluence space break when they are edited because the spacekey is dropped

fields.description:
We're running with confluence 4.3.3 as a tomcat6 WAR, using delegated LDAP Posix Authentication and a MySQL 5.5 database...

Profile Email Addresses are erased for some users.  Not all users are affected. The same users are affected each time this occurs. The latest observation on one user is that the email address lasted one day.

This is a significant issue for us as we make use of notifications (*mentions*) and we use *Ad Hoc Workflows* to control our _Document Management System_ which is Confluence-based. Notifications generated by *Ad Hoc Workflows* and *mentions* do not function if the email address is not present in the user profile. 

Our usernames match our email addresses, so a fully qualified email address is not necessary in order to send an email to another user, but we've found that the administrator needs to specify email addresses in all users' profiles for the emails to be sent by *Ad Hoc Workflows* and *mentions*.  A day or two later, when the administrator checks again, many of the user's email addresses are blank and need to be added once more.
fields.summary: Profile Email Addresses are erased for some users

fields.description:
h4. Steps to Reproduce:
# Create a user with the following details:
|| username || Full Name ||
| halatas | H usein usein|
| wsmith | W smith |
| foobar | 畑 太郎 |
# Wait until these users' USERINFO/PersonalInformation objects are being created and indexed. To confirm, you can check in People Directory
# Open up a page and try enter the following:
#- H
#- H usein
#- W
#- W smith
#- 畑
#- 畑 太郎
Note that you'll get _(!) No matching user or email found_ instead of the right result.

h5. Workaround
- Enter their username instead. For example of the sample above, you should enter these:
-- halatas
-- wsmith
-- foobar
- Enter user's full email address

h5. Possible cause and findings
It seems that the REST call for the user auto suggestion ({{http://<Confluence-URL>/rest/prototype/1/search/user.json?max-results=10&query=<value>}}) will only be triggered in the second character typed. Also, in fact, if let's say it can be triggered in the first character typed, apparently Confluence returns nothing for single letter query (e.g. 'W') and also returns nothing for a query that consists of one letter for the first name (e.g. 'W Smith'). You can see this behaviour by hitting these URLs after having such data mentioned above:
- http://<Confluence-URL>/rest/prototype/1/search/user.json?max-results=10&query=w (will return nothing)
- http://<Confluence-URL>/rest/prototype/1/search/user.json?max-results=10&query=w+smith (will return nothing)
- http://<Confluence-URL>/rest/prototype/1/search/user.json?max-results=10&query=wsmith (will return an expected result)
fields.summary: Share Page user auto suggestion does not work if you type one letter only then continued (or not) by a space

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28047].
  {panel}

The status messages that the long running Import task sets to its ProgressMeter could be improved in the following ways:
- Update the status when unzipping the export archive. Currently, if the archive is large and takes a while to unzip, the user sees the message "Starting..." for a long time, which can be unsettling. Even if no detailed progress of the unzipping status is shown, simply indicating that the file is being unzipped would have a soothing effect (at least on me).
- Update the status when processing attachments. Currently, if there are many attachments, the user sees the message "Entities loaded..."  for a long time. Similarly to above, I think just indicating that attachments are being processed would be beneficial (as a user, I'd expect this step to take a while if I have many attachments).
- Update the status during post-import tasks. Currently, the progress meter reports "Complete." even while post-import tasks are still running.
fields.summary: Improvements to Confluence's import status messages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28031].
  {panel}

At the present time, Confluence will not allow an administrator to edit the directory they are currently logged in from. For example, if logged into Confluence as a user from Crowd, the Crowd user directory will not be able to be modified. Normally we recommend logging in as the local Confluence admin in order to edit other directories.

However, when Crowd SSO is enabled, only users from the Crowd user directory can authenticate. To get around this, administrators will need to edit the seraph-config.xml to use the default Confluence authenticator instead of the Crowd SSO authenticator and restart Confluence in order to log in as the local admin. The application will require another restart to re-enable SSO.

This improvement request is to investigate if there's a better way to edit the Crowd user directory in Confluence when SSO is enabled.

The same is true of IIS with NTLM.
fields.summary: Provide a method for administrators to edit the remote user directory they are logged in from

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28021].
  {panel}

h4. Use case
# An LDAP user directory in Confluence is created with 'Read Only with Local Groups'
# An LDAP user is then placed in a local group, e.g. 'confluence-users'
# Later, it is decided that this group's memberships will be handled in LDAP, and a group of the same name is created (again for example 'confluence-users')

The result is that the LDAP 'confluence-users' members never get synced over since there's already an existing local group of the same name that contained at least one LDAP member at some point in time.

h4. Purpose
The purpose of this improvement request is to investigate a way allow the LDAP group to override the local group in this senario. In the mean time, there's a workaround, detailed below.

h4. Workaround
When the LDAP user is placed in the local group, a new row will be created in the _cwd_group_ table associated the local group with the _directory_id_ of the LDAP user directory. The row will have the _local_ column set to 'T' indicating that it is not a group from LDAP.

This flag, when set to 'T', apparently keeps the LDAP group of the same name from syncing.

# Shut down Confluence
# Update the row such that the _local_ column is set to 'F'
# Start Confluence, which will trigger a sync on startup

Please note the impact this will have on your user memberships:
* Local users and groups are not affected
* LDAP users in the local group will no longer have that membership relationship
* LDAP users will now belong in the LDAP group of the same name
fields.summary: Investigate a way to override local groups with LDAP groups of the same name when using 'Read Only with Local Groups'

fields.description:
1. Create a list (Bullet, Number, or Task)
2. Turn on a font effect while cursor is in the list. (Bold, Italic, etc)
3. Shift+Enter twice
(I'm not sure why I have to hit enter twice instead of once. Should be on a new-line font-effect button still on)
4. Start typing a macro, such as {note
(Tip, Info, Warning, etc also work, not sure about other macros)
You will notice that the macro command text itself has the font effect. e.g. "{note" is bold as you type it.
5. Hit Enter to activate the macro.
(You will now be in a Note box, you will notice that the font-effect is still on)
6. Type two words
7. Select the last word you just typed
8. Disable the font-effect (e.g. Disable Bold)

You will 3 instances of the macro box.
If the words I typed were "one two" and I selected "two" before disabling bold, the 3 boxes will contain

"one "
"two"
""

If you move the cursor into these boxes, the first and third will have bold enabled, the second will have it disabled.

Notes:
#7. You don't actually need to type two words, but if you select all of the text and disable the font-effect it doesn't reproduce the bug. You can also type a single world and just highlight the end of the word.

Also, once these duplicates are formed, you can repeat the bug over and over with the boxes that have the font-effect enabled. For example, I can type something in that last empty box that gets generated, highlight the last portion, try to disable bold again, and I get more boxes.

This bug also affects panel. I haven't tested others.

I'm not sure why I need to shift-click twice to get a blank line in a list sometimes and just once other times. This bug seems to happen either way.
fields.summary: Creating a macro (note, tip, etc) within a list with a font effect on, then disabling the effect in the macro box causes duplicates that macro.

We are receiving an error in Confluence where we can't save page edits because we don't have enough licenses.
The licensing page in Confluence Admin shows 50 users are licensed and we have 58 signed up.
We would like to remove some of our users that are signed up.
However, we cannot find how to list these 58 users.
Please let us know how we can list out the 58 users.
Will Hough
P.S. We are using Crowd as an authentication back-end.
fields.summary: Confluence users over license limit

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28015].
  {panel}

Error when adding a new page in a Space without Home page should be handled more gracefully. Currently it throws a System Error.

The system should display a warning informing the user that to be able to add a page, the space must have a Home page, because all pages created in a Space takes the Home page as their parent.

*Steps to reproduce:*

1. Create a Space.
2. Remove its Home page (as per image below):

!step_1.png!

3. Try to add a new page:

!step_2.png!

4. The system throws an error:

!step_3.png!

*Workaround:*

1. Create/Open another Space
2. Copy its Home page
3. Move the copy to the homeless Space
fields.summary: Error when adding page without Home page should be handled more gracefully

fields.description:
h4. Symptoms

A page has lots of inline task check boxes, and if you press lots of the checkboxes in quick succession, Confluence's CPU usage spikes.

It's a pretty rare case that there are so many check boxes like this which can be clicked enough to cause this, but there are some customers who use the checkboxes this way.

I believe the underlying cause here is that every time the check box is clicked, the entire page is saved back into Confluence, so if it's clicked repeatedly, there are a lot of saves happening all at once, causing database pool contention. A thread dump shows that many threads are locked waiting for the resource "com.mchange.v2.async.ThreadPoolAsynchronousRunner", indicating contention on the c3p0 thread pool. Eventually after stopping clicking the checkboxes, the CPU usage goes down, and threads are no longer locking on this resource.

h4. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a page in Confluence
# In that page, add lots and lots of inline tasks ([]), without linking to a user. It may help to create a big table, and fill every cell with a checkbox, where the associated caption is only ".".
# Save the page
# Click repeatedly on lots of check boxes
# Observe the high CPU usage
# Take a thread dump, and observe the high contention on the database connection pool resource

h4. Workaround

Edit the page, and click the checkboxes whilst in edit mode, as this will only cause a save after making all the changes, rather than with every click.

Alternatively, to disable the editing of inline task check boxes completely, disable the 'inline-tasks-resources' module of the Inline Tasks system plugin. To do so:

 (!) Please make sure to create a backup of your database and home directory before attempting this.

[Removing Malfunctioning Add-ons|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Removing+Malfunctioning+Add-ons] covers this process in depth, but below is a specific example for the inline-tasks-resources module.
# Shut down Confluence
# Run the following query:
{code}select BANDANAVALUE from BANDANA where BANDANAKEY = 'plugin.manager.state.Map'{code}
This will return a map that may look something like this:
{code}<map>
  <entry>
    <string>com.atlassian.confluence.ext.usage</string>
    <boolean>false</boolean>
  </entry>
</map>{code}
# Copy the existing entry and add an entry for the inline-tasks-resources module. For example:
{code}<map>
  <entry>
    <string>com.atlassian.confluence.ext.usage</string>
    <boolean>false</boolean>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <string>com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-inline-tasks</string>
    <boolean>false</boolean>
  </entry>
</map>{code}
If there are no entries, just add a single entry for the inline-tasks-resources module:
{code}<map>
  <entry>
    <string>com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-inline-tasks</string>
    <boolean>false</boolean>
  </entry>
</map>{code}
# Update the bandana table:
{code}update bandana set bandanavalue = '<YOUR NEW PLUGIN STATE MAP>' where bandanakey = 'plugin.manager.state.Map'{code}
# Restart Confluence
fields.summary: Multiple clicks on inline tasks causes Confluence to perform badly due to database thread pool contention

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Set up a global colour scheme
# Create a space with that scheme
#- Confirm the colours are as expected
# Change the space's theme to Documentation Theme
#- Observe that the default colours have been applied

h3. Fix
This can be fixed by reapplying the colour scheme to the space:
# Go to Space Admin > Colour Scheme
# Click to Select your custom colour scheme
fields.summary: Changing a space's theme reapplies the default colour scheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28001].
  {panel}

Before the last major update (months ago, from what I recall), the search box at the top right of the Confluence page would auto-search and display search results as I typed. We usually title our projects with a case number, followed by description.

Ever since that update, that search function hasn't been auto-searching for new cases. Old cases will still appear in the auto-search, but new ones created after that update no longer appear. Instead, the only way I can get to them is to browse through all the project or do a CTRL + F for the case number. I'm surprised this hasn't been fixed, it's been like this ofr months.

Steps to reproduce:
1) From the dashboard, click "Add Page"
2) Give the page whatever name you like and save it.
3) Type the first few words or a unique word used in the page's title into the search box at the top right of the window.
4) Notice that it doesn't show up in the auto-search results.
5) Even if you hit <Enter> to submit the search, no results will be found.
fields.summary: Search box does not auto-find new cases
Click on discard changes takes me to Page not Found
Changing application link name breaks all macros linked to that application
Confluence should've an option to clean everything up

fields.description:
Starting Confluence 4.3, there is [new feature|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+4.3+Release+Notes#Confluence4.3ReleaseNotes-Improveduserinvitationsandsignupoptions] where Confluence can send an email to the newly created user, so that the new user can reset their password immediately upon receiving the email.

When you have DELEGATING User Directory and positioned at the most top (first one), new user creation from Confluence will fall under the DELEGATING User Directory and not Confluence Internal User Directory. This is expected an by design (I _think_).

So when the admin ticked the "Send an email to the user you have just created, which will allow them to set up their password." when [adding that new user|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Adding+and+Inviting+Users#AddingandInvitingUsers-Addingusersmanually]:
!https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/138313/AddUsers.png!

!resetpasswd.png!

{code} 
It's expected to have this failing as one isn't allowed to reset DELEGATING LDAP User's password through Confluence.

To avoid confusion and lessen frustration of new user, perhaps we shall have a new logic to remove this feature if DELEGATING User Directory is positioned at the most top. Or perhaps, handle the error gracefully and provide a user friendly error in the page.

h4. Workaround
Switch the order of your User Directories so that Confluence Internal directory is the first, then create a new user afterward. Now the new user belongs to internal directory should be able to reset its passsword once they receive the email.
fields.summary: Creating user manually from Confluence when having DELEGATING User Directory at the most top should not send an email "Send an email to the user you have just created, which will allow them to set up their password"
"Add-on Templates" are displayed in Confluence and Space Admin, but cannot be used
Export of Confluence pages with Mathjax content

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27993].
  {panel}

Currently, when one does {{confluence2.storePage}} call of page with a title that already exists, one would get this exception:
{code}
org.springframework.transaction.UnexpectedRollbackException: Transaction rolled back because it has been marked as rollback-only
{code} 
As per [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/iYHbCg]:
bq. This is a result, not a cause. You must look at the stacktrace above this error in order to understand the root cause.

{code}
com.atlassian.confluence.rpc.RemoteException: A page already exists with the title All user editing tabs disappear after visiting "Items" tab in the space with key BUG
{code}
fields.summary: Improve XMLRPC API error when executing storePage method where a page with the same title already exists

fields.description:
Confluence offers a feature to send a newly created user an email that allows the user to setup his/her password. This email, however, is supposed to be optional as it can be ticked/unticked. However, the email appears to be always sent, even if the option '_Send an email to the user you have just created, which will allow them to set up their password._' is disabled.

Steps to reproduce:
# Ensure that an email (SMTP) server is properly setup in a Confluence instance and that you can receive other email such as a share notification
# Navigate to Confluence Admin
# Navigate to Users (under Users & Security)
# Click Add User
# Add a user and provide an email address that you have access to
# Create the user and leave the 'Send an email...' option unticked.
# Check the mailbox of the provided email address. You will receive mail, while you left the 'Send an email...' option unticked.
fields.summary: Email after user creation is always sent

fields.description:
It seems like the {{ehcache.xml}} file that lives in the {{config}} directory under the Confluence home directory is never updated during an upgrade. This means new cache entries added by developers never make it into upgraded production instances, which can lead to warnings in the log such as:

{noformat}
2013-02-05 14:58:14,195 WARN [RMI TCP Connection(2)-127.0.0.1] [sf.hibernate.cache.EhCacheProvider] buildCache Could not find configuration [com.atlassian.crowd.model.directory.DirectoryImpl.attributes]; using defaults.
2013-02-05 14:58:14,200 WARN [RMI TCP Connection(2)-127.0.0.1] [sf.hibernate.cache.EhCacheProvider] buildCache Could not find configuration [com.atlassian.crowd.model.group.InternalGroup]; using defaults.
2013-02-05 14:58:14,201 WARN [RMI TCP Connection(2)-127.0.0.1] [sf.hibernate.cache.EhCacheProvider] buildCache Could not find configuration [com.atlassian.crowd.model.directory.DirectoryImpl]; using defaults.
2013-02-05 14:58:14,202 WARN [RMI TCP Connection(2)-127.0.0.1] [sf.hibernate.cache.EhCacheProvider] buildCache Could not find configuration [com.atlassian.crowd.model.group.InternalGroupAttribute]; using defaults.
2013-02-05 14:58:14,203 WARN [RMI TCP Connection(2)-127.0.0.1] [sf.hibernate.cache.EhCacheProvider] buildCache Could not find configuration [com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.hibernate2.HibernateMembership]; using defaults.
{noformat}

We should:
# Replace ehcache.xml if it hasn't been customised
# Inject new entries into customised ehcache.xml files
# Clean up dead entries
# Allow plugins to define entries for their own caches
fields.summary: ehcache.xml is not updated when upgrading
